options something like that okay deeper in the money you go the less extrinsic value you have now further out of the money you go it's actually the same thing and why it's cu the options are cheaper and cheaper and cheaper there's only 25 cents of extrinsic value in these 105 they're just very very cheap why does that matter well because when Theta decays the Theta Decay curve is highest for options that are at the money because there's the most extrinsic value and Theta Decay actually slows down as you go deeper in the money because there's less extrinsic value and Theta DEC slows down when you go further out of the money because there's less extrinsic value that is at as a gross dollar amount so what I mean is if we look at Theta dek here for the at the Mony is it's like 40 cents if we go super far out of the money you'll notice it's all the way down to like 15 cents it essentially slows down a lot as a gross amount but if you look at it as a percentage of the remaining premium it's massive so if you do what a lot of new Traders do which is see oh I want cheap options I don't have a lot of money these options right here literally would cost me 28 bucks so I'll I'll buy those the probability of you getting a return on this is very very low

what a lot of new Traders do which is see oh I want cheap options I don't have a lot of money these options right here literally would cost me 28 bucks so I'll I'll buy those the probability of you getting a return on this is very very low you need a really big move and you need it fast because you only have 5 days before these are worth nothing and hey not to mention each time a day passes which they Decay is continuous by the way it's not just it's set and then the next day and then it comes out it's literally continuous um Decay on the options it's kind of HTI throughout the remaining time but if you look at this on a daily basis you're going to lose 15 cents out of your 28 so it means literally after one day passes you just essentially cut this in half that means that you now need an even bigger move before you can make money so this is why a lot of times when sophisticated Traders are trading calls we actually don't go super short in time and we don't go super far out of the money unless we're expecting a massive move if so then we would buy them we typically would call them something like kicker options but for me personally if I'm buying options I'm going to go at the very least typically two weeks 3 weeks out that's if it's

of the money unless we're expecting a massive move if so then we would buy them we typically would call them something like kicker options but for me personally if I'm buying options I'm going to go at the very least typically two weeks 3 weeks out that's if it's like super short term for me the vast majority of my premium buying whether it's calls or puts is going to be greater than 60 days and why is that because of this if you notice this is looking at in at the money option how it sta decays over time and notice what happens essentially from 100 to 60 days this slope is not that big but then notice once you get within 60 days to 40 40 to 20 20 to 10 and then all the way in beta starts decaying super super fast on a relative basis to the remaining premium I don't want to get stuck in this because this is the price for your long gamma that's what you're trying to get is rapid appreciation of your option which you might not see so it's a way to not lose a bunch of money but you're probably going to lose a whole bunch of times before you might win once and You' have to manage it very very smartly in order to have a positively expecting scenario so I really really like this post because it's reminding people that what looks really appealing AKA super

you're probably going to lose a whole bunch of times before you might win once and You' have to manage it very very smartly in order to have a positively expecting scenario so I really really like this post because it's reminding people that what looks really appealing AKA super cheap options actually have a lot going on underneath the surface that make them very difficult to make money with the last thing I'll say is the further out of the money you go the lower your Delta is and for those that don't know Delta is simply the rate of change of premium for one point move in the underlying so what that means is if GameStop goes up by a dollar these 42 calls have a Delta of 24 so if GameStop goes up by a dollar this premium will change by 24 whereas if you pay up a bit more and you're closer to at the money or even slightly in the money now if GameStop moves a dollar you see 50 cents of that move and if you're further in the money again more expensive still but now if GameStop goes a dollar instead of seeing 24 bucks you're going to see 80 bucks 80 cents times 100 that's the multiplier for options contracts so it's a bit of a balance that's the cool part about options you get to set them up to be exactly what you want if you expect a big big massive

24 bucks you're going to see 80 bucks 80 cents times 100 that's the multiplier for options contracts so it's a bit of a balance that's the cool part about options you get to set them up to be exactly what you want if you expect a big big massive move and you're super convicted you can go further out of the money and play the expansion of those Deltas or you can play a little more conservatively like I typically do I would go slightly in the money pay up for the options I would still have a management plan in place I at no point would expect to just hold these into expiration because then you do run the risk of losing more money if these fall out of the money I wouldn't want that to happen but you can get stuff that's in the money get a better Delta for dollar move based on what you put in a little more expensive and then you could also add a couple kicker options maybe like a 20 Delta something like that in case you get that big move but if you get a bit of a move but not big enough in order to make a bunch of money you can still walk out with a bit of a profit by having a slightly higher Delta it's a completely completely intricate game to play and this is why options are so cool to me because they're a puzzle
